summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to an unspecified recipient, regarding the provision of discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell. It details the delivery of a laptop, a hard drive, and a CD containing discovery productions, including replacements for files she was previously unable to review.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case, to whom discovery materials (laptop, hard drive, CD) are being provided for review.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the email, coordinating the delivery of discovery materials to the defendant, Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.person1: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: Prosecutor providing discovery materials to the defendant as part of the legal process.

events.title: Delivery of Discovery Materials to Maxwell
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney delivers a laptop, hard drive, and CD containing discovery productions to Ghislaine Maxwell for her review.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Prior Discovery Production Shipment
events.description: A hard drive containing a separate discovery production, including replacements for files Maxwell was unable to review, was sent via FedEx.

keyFacts: On November 18, 2020, discovery materials including a laptop, hard drive, and CD were provided to Ghislaine Maxwell for her review.
The prosecution was providing replacements for numerous files from prior productions that Maxwell had been unable to access.
A separate hard drive production had been sent via FedEx the prior week (around November 9, 2020).
The correspondence is from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York, indicating active pre-trial evidence sharing in Maxwell's case.
